headline: Walmart and Google bet on AI agents to reshape how people shop online

headline: Walmart Expanding Drone Delivery to Hundreds More Stores
summary: Walmart  says it plans to roll out delivery-by-drone at an additional 150 stores over the next year in partnership with drone operator Wing, a unit of Alphabet.  The effort represents an ambitious expansion of the retailer’s previously announced plans for drone delivery, which is currently mostly limited to the Dallas-Fort Worth and Atlanta regions.  Wing estimates that more than 40 million Walmart shoppers would have access to the service after the expansion, up from roughly 2 million today.

headline: Wing to expand drone delivery to another 150 Walmart stores
summary: The partnership will grow Wing's drone delivery service to more than 270 Walmart stores by 2027.

headline: Walmart and Google Turn AI Discovery Into Effortless Shopping Experiences
